Title: Makes the extension of certain local emergency orders subject to the approval of the local governing body
Summary: Makes a proclamation extending a local state of emergency issued by the chief executive subject to the approval of the local governing body of the applicable county, city, town or village; provides that all orders issued by a local board of health shall be effective for a period of five days; requires approval by the applicable local governing body for each extension thereof.

ActClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law and the public health law, in relation to making the extension of certain local emergency orders subject to the approval of the local governing body
